column1: What is the supreme law of the land?
column8: The Constitution established the government and laws and it guarantees basic rights to citizens. Without it, we wouldn’t have three branches of government!
column12: The Constitution established the government and laws and it guarantees basic rights to citizens. Without it, we wouldn’t have three branches of government!

column1: How many amendments does the Constitution have?
column8: The Constitution was amended 27 times, most recently in 1992. The first 10 amendments are also called the Bill of Rights.

column1: If both the president and the vice president can no longer serve, who becomes president?
column8: After the vice president, the speaker of the house (currently Nancy Pelosi) is next in line to be president. The line-up is designed so presidents can't get anywhere close to naming their own successors.
column12: After the vice president, the speaker of the house (currently Nancy Pelosi) is next in line to be president. The line-up is designed so presidents can't get anywhere close to naming their own successors.

column1: Who was president during the Great Depression and World War II?
column8: Franklin Delano Roosevelt created “the New Deal,” a program to help handle the economic crisis nicknamed “the Great Depression.” The program aimed to increase jobs and solidify financial security for workers.

column1: When was the Declaration of Independence adopted?
column8: Written by Thomas Jefferson, the Declaration of Independence was adopted July 4th, 1776 — hence Independence Day!

column1: Before he was president, Eisenhower was a general. What war was he in?
column8: Eisenhower served in World War II as commander of US forces and supreme commander of the Allies in Europe before serving two terms as president. Talk about an overachiever!

column1: In what month do we vote for President?
column8: Presidential elections happen every four years in the U.S.. Some of the candidates for the 2020 election include Donald Trump (for reelection), Bernie Sanders and Kamala Harris.

column1: How many justices are on the Supreme Court?
column8: There are nine justices who serve for life on the U.S. Supreme Court. On the current court, Clarence Thomas has served the longest — 27 years!

column8: The Constitution was written in 1787 by James Madison — the fourth president of the United States. Nine of the thirteen states had to ratify it before it was adopted.

column1: Who is the “Father of Our Country”?
column8: George Washington is known as the “Father of Our Country.” After all, he’s the first president and on all of our dollar bills!
